## Python Flask Application Example

```python
from flask import Flask
app = Flask(__name__)

@app.route("/")
def hello():
    return "Hello World!"
```

## Example Go microservice application (main.go)

```go
package main

import (
	"net/http"
	"os"

	"github.com/labstack/echo/v4"
	"github.com/labstack/echo/v4/middleware"
)

func main() {

	e := echo.New()

	e.Use(middleware.Logger())
	e.Use(middleware.Recover())

	e.GET("/", func(c echo.Context) error {
		return c.HTML(http.StatusOK, "Hello, Docker! <3")
	})

	e.GET("/health", func(c echo.Context) error {
		return c.JSON(http.StatusOK, struct{ Status string }{Status: "OK"})
	})

	httpPort := os.Getenv("PORT")
	if httpPort == "" {
		httpPort = "8080"
	}

	e.Logger.Fatal(e.Start(":" + httpPort))
}

// Simple implementation of an integer minimum
// Adapted from: https://gobyexample.com/testing-and-benchmarking
func IntMin(a, b int) int {
	if a < b {
		return a
	}
	return b
}
```

## Docker Scout Comparison Overview Output Example

```text
## Overview

                    │                    Analyzed Image                     │              Comparison Image
────────────────────┼───────────────────────────────────────────────────────┼─────────────────────────────────────────────
  Target            │  dhi.io/node:22-debian13                              │  node:22
    digest          │  55d471f61608                                         │  9ee3220f602f
    tag             │  22-debian13                                          │  22
    platform        │ linux/amd64                                           │ linux/amd64
    provenance      │ https://github.com/docker-hardened-images/definitions │ https://github.com/nodejs/docker-node.git
                    │  9fe491f53122b84eebba81e13f20157c18c10de2             │  bf78d7603fbea92cd3652edb3b2edadd6f5a3fe8
    vulnerabilities │    0C     0H     0M     0L                            │    0C     1H     3M   153L     4?
                    │           -1     -3   -153     -4                     │
    size            │ 41 MB (-367 MB)                                       │ 408 MB
    packages        │ 19 (-726)                                             │ 745
```

## Extract Docker Scout Comparison Overview Using Shell Commands

```bash
$ docker scout compare dhi.io/node:22-debian13 \
    --to node:22 \
    --platform linux/amd64 \
    --ignore-unchanged \
    2>/dev/null | sed -n '/## Overview/,/^  ## /p' | head -n -1
```

## GET /info

```APIDOC
## GET /info

### Description
Returns system information.

### Method
GET

### Endpoint
/info

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **KernelMemory** (integer) - Omitted if not supported.
- **KernelMemoryTCP** (integer) - Omitted if not supported.
```

## docker sandbox ls

```APIDOC
## CLI COMMAND docker sandbox ls

### Description
List sandboxes.

### Method
CLI Command

### Endpoint
docker sandbox ls

### Request Example
```bash
docker sandbox ls
```

### Response
#### Success Response
A table listing all available sandboxes with their IDs, names, and status.
```text
SANDBOX_ID          NAME                 STATUS
my_ai_sandbox_id    my_ai_sandbox        running
another_id          test_agent_sandbox   stopped
```
```

texts = [...]

## GET /models

```APIDOC
## GET /models

### Description
List all local models currently available in Docker Model Runner. This provides an overview of all registered models and their basic information.

### Method
GET

### Endpoint
/models

### Parameters
No parameters.

### Request Example
(No request body required)

### Response
#### Success Response (200)
- **models** (array) - A list of model objects.
  - **name** (string) - The name of the model.
  - **namespace** (string) - The namespace of the model.
  - **status** (string) - The current status of the model (e.g., "ready", "loading").

#### Response Example
{
  "models": [
    {
      "name": "smollm2",
      "namespace": "ai",
      "status": "ready"
    },
    {
      "name": "my-custom-model",
      "namespace": "my-org",
      "status": "ready"
    }
  ]
}
```

## RUN --mount Syntax Overview

```Dockerfile
RUN --mount=[type=TYPE][,option=<value>[,option=<value>]...]
```
